abstract: ABET is a not-for-profit, nongovernmental accreditor of degree granting programs in applied science, computing, engineering, and engineering technology. ABET uses a peer review process to evaluate academic programs at the associate, bachelor, and masterâ€™s levels. This paper discusses the evolution of the ABET accreditation system from an input-based system which focused on what was being taught, to an outcomes-based system which focuses on what is being learned.
authors: P.E Michael K. J. Milligan Ph.D.
meta: In book: Proceedings of the International Conference on Transformations in Engineering Education (pp.25-28)
